header_summary:
Ava Chow announced the release of Bitcoin Core version 28.1, highlighting new features, bug fixes, performance enhancements, and the update's compatibility with major operating systems. This version also introduces a change in the peer-to-peer configuration to prevent port collisions for users running multiple nodes. Users are encouraged to download the update from [Bitcoin Core's official website](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-28.1) and report any issues on GitHub. 

Jameson Lopp raised concerns on the Bitcoin Development Mailing List about the potential for manipulation of transaction prioritization through the misuse of timestamp data, such as nLockTime, by adversaries. This manipulation could undermine new prioritization rules and lead to a "race to the bottom," making the rules ineffective. The discussion underscores the need for careful consideration in securing transaction timestamp integrity to prevent gaming of the system. Further details can be found [here](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/f1a0153b-3142-4e01-a68e-92c458762b89@dashjr.org/T/#md45faf348c4d6ff9b7a87019770ad6967382bd2a).

A proposal by Matt Corallo suggests an innovative approach to blockchain changes through soft forks by disabling key spending on P2TR addresses and using `OP_SUCCESS` opcodes for a post-quantum signature scheme, indicating a shift towards more secure and space-saving methods. This proposition has sparked discussions on the implementation of hash-based signatures, with a focus on efficiency and future-proofing against quantum computing threats. The detailed proposal and ongoing discussions can be explored [here](https://groups.google.com/g/bitcoindev/c/8O857bRSVV8).

Antoine Riard is considering legal action against Matthew Corallo over disagreements stemming from their collaboration on the rust-lightning project, highlighting deeper issues of governance and respect within open-source software projects. Riard's move underscores the challenges of collaboration in decentralized environments and the potential for legal precedents in open-source governance. This development has attracted attention beyond their immediate network, emphasizing the complexities of leadership and contribution in the open-source community. More information is available [here](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/code-of-conduct-violation-banning-antoine-riard-for-3-months/1254/3).

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Core 28.1 Released
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core version 28.1 is now available, offering new features and various improvements.
- The update supports Linux Kernel 3.17+, macOS 11.0+, and Windows 7 or newer.
- Significant release changes include P2P configuration adjustments and enhanced key handling.

recent_posts.title: Mandatory Inclusion of Old Transactions in Blocks
recent_posts.summary:
- Jameson Lopp criticizes a Bitcoin transaction timestamp flaw.
- He warns against abuse by setting nLockTime to past dates for unfair prioritization.
- Lopp fears this could lead to ineffective "race to the bottom" in system gaming.

recent_posts.title: Analyzing Mining Pool Behavior to Address Bitcoin Core's Double Coinbase Reservation Issue
recent_posts.summary:
- A Bitcoin Core update sets a minimal block weight at 2000 WU, prompting analysis.
- Anomalies in F2Pool's block weights suggest custom settings, deviating from norms.
- Investigating F2Pool's weight management could unveil insights for the Bitcoin community.

recent_posts.title: Proposing a P2QRH BIP towards a quantum resistant soft fork
recent_posts.summary:
- The discussion highlights evolving blockchain change implementations, focusing on soft forks over DASK.
- Matt Corallo suggests using `OP_SUCCESS` opcodes for post-quantum security in taproot script-path branches.
- The discourse suggests adopting hash-based signatures, like WOTS or FORS, for their efficiency and security.

recent_posts.title: Code of Conduct Violation: Banning Antoine Riard for 3 months
recent_posts.summary:
- Antoine Riard plans to sue Matthew Corallo, citing misrepresentation and manipulation.
- Their dispute, rooted in their work on rust-lightning, involves governance issues in open-source projects.  - Riard seeks a legal resolution, open to taking it to the US Supreme Court if needed.

active_posts.title: Summary: Covenants Support - Bitcoin Wiki
active_posts.summary:
- Significant updates were added to the Bitcoin covenants wiki in November 2024.
- Feedback emphasized the importance of opcode discussion and technical consensus.
- A call for more developer engagement and comprehensive reviews was highlighted.

active_posts.title: Mandatory Inclusion of Old Transactions in Blocks
active_posts.summary:
- This proposal mandates Bitcoin miners to include at least 0.1% old transactions in blocks.
- The goal is to combat mining centralization and potential transaction censorship issues.
- It ensures fairness by requiring the inclusion of older, low-fee transactions for validation.

active_posts.title: Bitcoin Core 28.1 Released
active_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core version 28.1 is now available, featuring new updates and bug fixes.
- Users should shut down older versions before installing the new release to avoid issues.
- Significant changes include P2P configuration adjustments and compatibility updates.

active_posts.title: PPLNS with job declaration
active_posts.summary:
- The SV2 extension is being developed to improve transparency and fairness in mining payouts.
- This extension gives miners the choice to select transactions, affecting fee structures.
- The project, still in development, seeks contributions for refinement and finalization.

active_posts.title: Contract-level Relative Timelocks (or, let's talk about ancestry proofs and singletons)
active_posts.summary:
- Reading a transaction ID in blockchain poses significant challenges.
- An innovative solution is the 1-input/2-output transaction structure.
- This method streamlines data extraction, improving singleton use by spenders.

active_posts.title: Workgroup lifecycle
active_posts.summary:
- The cluster mempool working group was formed on November 1, 2023, to manage technical discussions.
- By November 30, discussions were made publicly readable to widen audience engagement without new memberships.
- Finally, with the project's advancement, the group closed, transitioning discussions for broader access and future research.

today_in_history_posts.title: CTV BIP review
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Luke Dashjr reviews BIP and discusses Covenants, including improvements and limitations.
- He criticizes BIP 9's deployment as flawed, advocating for BIP 8's use instead.
- Dashjr notes P2SH's incompatibility with CHECKTEMPLATEVERIFY, affecting covenants and policy.

today_in_history_posts.title: [RFC] Lightning gossip alternative
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Rusty Russell suggests a v2 gossip protocol with x-only pubkeys and BIP-340 signatures.
- Weekly node announcements require UTXO ownership, influencing broadcast permissions and anti-spam measures.
- The proposal reduces message requirements and simplifies UTXO validation, yet leaves channel claim questions unanswered.

today_in_history_posts.title: Lightning transactions with v3 and ephemeral anchors
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Proposed changes use v3 transactions and ephemeral anchors to improve lightning transactions.
- These modifications aim to simplify transaction structure and decouple on-chain fees from off-chain funds.
- Transition strategies include non-disruptive upgrade paths, with consideration for development timelines.
